quotes.quote: To hold a testimony, one must bear it often and live worthy of it.
Never silence your testimony. It's meant for someone else; not you.
Testimony is to know and to feel, Conversion is to do and to become.
How you live your life is a testimony of what you believe about God.
The flame of testimony burns brightly when fed with the oil of grace.
If lips and life do not agree, the testimony will not amount to much.
Testimony is contingent on experience, that's why we're all free spirits.
There is abundant testimony that if we choose love rather than self, we gain immeasurably.
No one can argue with a testimony, it is not a debatable issue. It is there to be accepted or rejected.
Sometimes a single phrase of testimony can set events in motion that affect someone's life for eternity.
With a strong testimony of the Savior and His restored gospel, you have limitless opportunities to shine.
You know your testimony is strong when your roots are so deep that other people's storms will never knock you over.
No human testimony can have such force as to prove a miracle, and make it a just foundation for any such system of religion.
What you receive from others is a testimony to their virtue; but all that you do for others is the sign and clear indication of your own.
I will live and die by this testimony: that I loved a good conscience; that I never invaded another man's liberty; and that I preserved my own.
If you look at a testimony of love from 2,000 years ago it can still exactly speak to you, whereas medical advice from only 100 years ago is ridiculous.
There is absolutely nothing in this world that will provide more comfort and happiness than a testimony of the truth.
Testimony always comes from people who are in some way disempowered.
Testimony is not something you have today, and you are going to have always. A testimony is fragile. It is as hard to hold as a moonbeam. It is something you have to recapture every day of your life.

The greatest testimony to the human spirit that I'm witnessing now is the fact that people still come back to work, after all that has been done to them. They are still willing to participate for a more positive future if they would be sincerely invited.

The testimony of scripture is so plain that to add anything were superfluous, were it not that the world is almost now come to that blindness, that whatsoever pleases not the princes and the multitude, the same is rejected as doctrine newly forged, and is condemned for heresy.
Testimony gives something to be interpreted.
If you want a testimony, you are going to have a test.
Your personal testimony, however meaningful it is to you, is not the gospel.
A testimony is a testimony, and it should be respected, whether it is small or large.
We acquire a testimony of the principles of the gospel by obediently trying to live them.
Expressions of solemn testimony have long been important to the children of God upon the earth.
Testimony demands to be interpreted because of the dialectic of meaning and event that traverses it.
No matter what eyewitness testimony is in the court of law, it is the lowest form of evidence in the court of science.
The value given to the testimony of any feeling must depend on our whole philosophy, not our whole philosophy on a feeling.
